english: Of course!
yoruba: Ìyẹn dájú!

english: Nostalgia is when you remember and feel happy about things from the past, like fun times, favorite toys, or special places.
yoruba: Aáyun jẹ́ ìgbàtí o bá rántí, tí inú rẹ sì dùn nípa àwọn ohun àtẹ̀hìnwá kan, bíi àwọn ìgbà ìgbádùn, àwọn ohun ìṣeré ọmọdé tí o fẹ́ràn, tàbí àwọn ibìkan tó ṣe pàtàkì.

english: It's like looking at old pictures and feeling really good inside because you remember how much you enjoyed those moments.
yoruba: Ó dàbíi kí o má a wo àwọn àwòrán tí o yà nígbà àtijọ́, kí inú rẹ sì má a dùn gidi nítorí tí o rántí bí o ṣe gbádùn àwọn àsìkò yẹn tó.

english: Suggest an idea to celebrate together the birthday of four people born on different days .
yoruba: Dámọ̀ràn èrò kan láti fi ṣàjọyọ̀ ọjọ́-ìbí àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rin kan tí a bí ní ọjọ́ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ papọ̀.

english: How about having a "Four Seasons" party?
yoruba: Tí ẹ bá ṣe àpèjọpọ̀ “Aláàkókò Mẹ́rin” ńkọ́?

english: Each person represents a different season, so you could decorate the party area with things related to each season, play games that match the seasons, and have treats that remind everyone of different times of the year.
yoruba: Ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan yóò dúró fún àkókò ọ̀tọ̀ kan, nípa bẹ́ẹ̀ ẹ̀yin yóò lè ṣe ibi àríyá ọ̀hún lẹ́ṣọ̀ọ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn ohun tó bá àkókò kọ̀ọ̀kan mu, ẹ̀yin yóò lè ṣe àwọn eré tó bá àkókò náà mu, ẹ̀yin yóò sì lè ṣe fàájì tí yóò rán gbogbo yín létí àwọn oríṣiríṣi àkókò inú ọdún.

english: It's a fun way to celebrate everyone's unique birthdays together!
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìgbádùn láti fi ṣàjọyọ̀ ọjọ́-ìbí ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan lápapọ̀.

english: What is that?
yoruba: Kí nìyẹn?

english: I apologize if my previous response was unclear.
yoruba: Mo tọọrọ gáfárà bí esì mi tẹ́lẹ̀rí náà kò bá yé ọ.

english: The "Four Seasons" party idea involves celebrating the birthdays of four people born on different days by assigning each person to a different season of the year: spring, summer, fall, and winter.
yoruba: Èrò àpèjọpọ̀ “Aláàkókò Mẹ́rin” náà níí ṣe pẹ̀lú ṣíṣàjọ̀dún ọjọ́-ìbí àwọn ènìyàn mẹ́rin tí a bí ní ọjọ́ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ nípa pípín ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan sí àkókò ọdún ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀; ìgbà ìrúwé, ìgbà ooru, ìgbà ìrẹ̀dànù ewé, àti ìgbà òtútù.

english: The party decorations, games, and treats would then be themed around each season to create a festive and diverse celebration.
yoruba: Àwọn ohun ìṣẹ̀ṣọ́ ibi ayẹyẹ náà, àwọn ohun ìṣeré, àti àwọn ohun-èlò fún fàájì náà ni ẹ lè wá mú kí ó bá àkókò kọ̀ọ̀kan mu láti lè ṣẹ̀dá àjọ̀dún tó láyọ̀, tó sì ní oríṣiríṣi ẹ̀ka.

english: Any other suggestions?
yoruba: Ìmọ̀ràn mìíràn tún wà bí?

english: Certainly!
yoruba: Dájúdájú!

english: How about a "Around-the-World" themed party? Each person can represent a different country or culture.
yoruba: Tí ẹ bá ṣe àyẹyẹ tí àkòrí rẹ̀ jẹ́ “Káàkiri Àgbáyé” ńkọ́? Ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan lè dúró fún orílẹ̀-èdè tàbí àṣà ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.

english: You can have decorations, activities, and food from each person's chosen place, making it a fun and educational way to celebrate together.
yoruba: Ẹ lè ní àwọn ohun ìṣelélọ́ṣọ̀ọ́, àwọn ohun àmúṣe, àti oúnjẹ láti agbègbè yóòwù tí ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan bá yàn, èyítí yóò mú kó jẹ́ ọ̀nà tó ládùn, tó lárinrin, tó sì ń kọ́nilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ láti jọ ṣàjọ̀dún papọ̀.

english: It's a way to learn about different parts of the world and enjoy each other's unique birthdays.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà láti kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ nípa àwọn oríṣiríṣi ìlú tó wà láyé, àti láti gbádùn ọjọ́-ìbí ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan.

english: More suggestions please.
yoruba: Ìmọ̀ràn síwájú síi, jọ̀wọ́.

english: Of course!
yoruba: Ìyẹn dájú!

english: Another idea could be a "Colorful Celebration" party.
yoruba: Èrò mìíràn tún lè jẹ́ àpéjọpọ̀ “Ayẹyẹ Ọlọ́pọ̀-àwọ̀”.

english: Each person could pick their favorite color, and the party decorations, activities, and even the food could revolve around those chosen colors.
yoruba: Ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan lè yan àwọ̀ tí wọ́n bá fẹ́ràn jùlọ, àti àwọn ohun ìṣelélẹ́ṣọ̀ọ́ fún ayẹyẹ náà, àti àwọn ohun àmúṣe, oúnjẹ náà sì lè bá àwọn oríṣiríṣi àwọ̀ tí ẹ bá yàn náà lọ pàápàá.

english: It would be a vibrant and lively way to celebrate everyone's birthdays together.
yoruba: Yóò jẹ́ ọ̀nà tó ládùn, tó sì lárinrin láti ṣàjọ̀dún ọjọ́-ìbí ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan papọ̀.

english: What about gifts?
yoruba: Àwọn ẹ̀bùn ńkọ́?

english: For gifts, you could consider a "Secret Buddy" exchange.
yoruba: Fún ẹ̀bùn, ẹ lè ronú nípa pàṣípààrọ̀ “Ọ̀rẹ́ Ìpamọ́”.

english: Each person draws the name of another person and buys a gift for that person.
yoruba: Ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan yóò dijú yan orúkọ ẹlòmíràn, yóò sì ra ẹ̀bùn fún ẹni náà.

english: This way, everyone gets a special gift, and it adds an element of surprise and anticipation to the celebration.
yoruba: Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan yóò gba ẹ̀bùn pàtàkì, èyí yóò sì mú kí èrò ohun ìyanu àti ìfojúsọ́nà jẹ́ ara ayẹyẹ náà.

english: It's a thoughtful way to show appreciation for each other on your shared birthday celebration.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà tó dára láti fi ìmoore hàn fún ara yín níbi ayẹyẹ àjọ̀dún ọjọ́-ìbí àjọṣe yín.

english: Another idea please
yoruba: Ìmọ̀ràn mìíràn, jọ̀wọ́

english: Certainly!
yoruba: Dájúdájú!

english: How about a "DIY Craft Party"?
yoruba: Tí ẹ bá ṣe “Àpèjọpọ̀ Iṣẹ́-ọnà Àfúnraẹniṣe” ńkọ́?

english: Each person could prepare a simple craft activity that they enjoy, and everyone can rotate through the different craft stations.
yoruba: Ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan lè ṣètò ohun àmúṣe iṣẹ́-ọnà kan tí wọ́n fẹ́ràn láti má a ṣe, gbogbo yín sì lè lọ yípò gbogbo àwọn ibùdó iṣẹ́-ọnà ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ náà.

english: This way, you'll create personalized gifts for each other, and you'll also have a fun and creative time together.
yoruba: Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ẹ̀yin yóò ṣẹ̀dá ẹ̀bùn tó jẹ́ tara-ẹni fún ara yín, ẹ̀yin yóò sì tún lè lo àsìkò papọ̀ fún ìgbádùn àti fún ṣíṣẹ̀dá àwọn ohun tuntun.

english: It's a way to celebrate while making special memories and meaningful gifts.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà láti ṣàjọyọ̀ lásìkò kan náà tí ẹ̀ ń fi ìdí ìrántí rere àti ẹ̀bùn tó nítumọ̀ lélẹ̀.

english: Another still
yoruba: Òmíràn síbẹ̀

english: Absolutely!
yoruba: Dájúdájú!

english: Consider a "Memory Lane" party.
yoruba: Ẹ lè ronú nípa àpéjọpọ̀ “Ipa-ọ̀nà Ìrántí”.

english: Each person could bring a small item or picture that represents a favorite memory they have with the birthday group.
yoruba: Ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan lè mú nǹkan kékeré kan tàbí àwòrán kan wá, èyí tó dúró fún ohun ìrántí pàtàkì kan tí wọ́n ní pẹ̀lú ẹgbẹ́ ọlọ́jọ́-ìbí náà.

english: Take turns sharing these memories and stories, and then create a collaborative scrapbook or art piece to commemorate the occasion.
yoruba: Gbogbo yín lè dìde lọ́kọ̀ọ̀kan láti sọ nípa àwọn ohun ìrántí àti ìtàn náà, kí ẹ sì ya àwọn àwòràn tí ẹ ó jọ fi ṣẹ̀dá ìwé àwòrán tàbí ohun ìyàwòránsí láti má a fi ṣèrántí ayẹyẹ náà.

english: It's a sentimental and heartwarming way to celebrate your unique bond and the memories you've created together.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìwúrí àti ìdùnnú láti ṣàjọyọ̀ àsopọ̀ yín tó dá yàtọ̀ àti àwọn ohun ìrántí tí ẹ ti jọ ṣẹ̀dá papọ̀.

english: I work as a language service service provider, with a registered agency that outsource tasks to language professionals, and with two competent Project Managers.
yoruba: Mò ń ṣiṣẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè tó ní ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje kan tí a forúkọ rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba, tó má a ń gbé iṣẹ́ fún àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ nínú èdè, tó sì ní àwọn Olùṣàkóso Àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ méjì.

english: Describe my experience as a language service provider.
yoruba: Ṣàpèjúwe ìrírí mi gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè.

english: As a language service provider (LSP) with a registered agency that outsources tasks to language professionals and with two competent Project Managers, your experience is likely to be multifaceted and dynamic.
yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè tó ní ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje tí a forúkọ rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba, tó má a ń gbé iṣẹ́ fún àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ nínú èdè, tó sì ní àwọn Olùṣàkóso Àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ méjì, ìrírí rẹ ṣeé ṣe kí ó jẹ́ èyí tó pín sí ọ̀nà tó pọ̀, tó sì lè má a yípadà láti ìgbà dé ìgbà.

english: Here's a description of your typical experience:
yoruba: Èyí ni àpèjúwe ìrírí rẹ bí ó ṣe yẹ kí ó rí:

english: Business Operations:
yoruba: Àwọn Iṣẹ́-ṣiṣe tó jẹ mọ́ Ìṣòwò:

english: ou oversee the day-to-day operations of your language service agency.
yoruba: Ìwọ má a ń ṣàbójútó àwọn iṣẹ́-ṣíṣe ojoojúmọ́ ti ilé-iṣẹ́ èdè kéréje rẹ.

english: This includes managing administrative tasks, maintaining legal compliance, and ensuring smooth business processes.
yoruba: Lára àwọn wọ̀nyí ni ṣíṣàkóso àwọn iṣẹ́ ìṣètò, fífi ìdí ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún òfin múlẹ̀, àti rírí i dájú pé àwọn ìlànà iṣòwò ń lọ déédé.

english: Team Management:
yoruba: Ìṣàkóso Ẹgbẹ́:

english: You work closely with two competent Project Managers who play a pivotal role in the project's success.
yoruba: Ìwọ ń ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn Olùṣàkóso Àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ méjì tó mọṣẹ́, tí wọ́n ń ṣe ojúṣe tó jẹ́ kókó nínú àṣeyọrí àwọn àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ náà.

english: They are responsible for coordinating assignments, liaising with clients, and overseeing linguistic quality.
yoruba: Àwọn ni wọ́n ni ojúṣe ìṣàkóso àwọn ìpínṣẹ́fúnni, bíbá àwọn oníbàárà dúnàádúrà, àti ṣíṣàbójútó ìdárasí ohun gbogbo tó níí ṣe pẹ̀lú èdè.

english: Client Relations:
yoruba: Ìbáṣepọ̀ Oníbàárà:

english: Building and maintaining relationships with clients is crucial.
yoruba: Ìṣàgbékalẹ̀ àti ìmúdúró ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn oníbàárà ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀.

english: You interact with clients to understand their language service needs, negotiate contracts, and address any concerns or feedback they may have.
yoruba: Ẹ ó má a ní ìbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn oníbàárà láti lè mọ àwọn ohun tí wọ́n nílò nípa iṣẹ́ èdè, láti jíròrò lórí àwọn àdéhùn, àti láti wá ojúùtú sí àwọn àníyàn tàbí èsì yòówù tí wọ́n lè ní.

english: Language Professional Network:
yoruba: Ìtàkùn Àwọn Akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ Èdè:

english: Your agency has a network of skilled language professionals, including translators, interpreters, editors, and other linguistic experts.
yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ ní ìtàkùn àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ èdè, lára àwọn èyí tó lè jẹ́ àwọn aṣètumọ̀-èdè, àwọn ògbùfọ̀, àwọn aṣàtúnkọ àṣìṣe inú àkọsílẹ̀, àti àwọn ọ̀mọ̀ràn mìíràn nínú iṣẹ́ èdè.

english: You recruit, onboard, and maintain relationships with these professionals to ensure a reliable pool of talent.
yoruba: Ẹ ó má a gbanisíṣẹ́, ẹ ó má a fọ̀nà han àwọn tí ẹ bá gbà síṣẹ́, ẹ ó sì má a mú kí ìbáṣepọ̀ yín pẹ̀lú àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ wọ̀nyí fẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ láti lè ní àkójọ àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tó ṣeé gbáralé.

english: Project Management:
yoruba: Ìṣàkóso Àkànṣe-iṣẹ́:

english: Your Project Managers are responsible for assigning tasks to language professionals, setting deadlines, and ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget.
yoruba: Àwọn Olùṣàkóso Àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ rẹ ni ó ni ojúṣe àti yan iṣẹ́ fún àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ èdè, tí wọn yóò ṣetò àkókò tí wọ́n gbọ́dọ̀ parí iṣẹ́ náà, tí wọn yóò sì ríi dájú pé wọ́n parí àwọn àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ lásìkò tó yẹ pẹ̀lú iye owó tó wà nílẹ̀.

english: They also oversee quality control and may use various translation and project management tools.
yoruba: Wọ́n yóò tún máa a ṣàbójútó ìṣàkóso ìdárasí, wọ́n sì lè má a lo àwọn oríṣiríṣi irin-iṣẹ́ ìṣètúmọ̀-èdè àti ìṣàkóso àkànṣe-iṣẹ́.

english: Quality Assurance:
yoruba: Àmúdájú Ìdárasí:

english: Quality control is paramount in the language services industry.
yoruba: Ìṣàkóso ìdárasí jẹ́ ohun tó ṣe kókó ní àwọn ilé-iṣẹ́ tó ń pèsè iṣẹ́ èdè.

english: Your agency and Project Managers implement rigorous quality assurance processes to guarantee accurate and culturally appropriate translations, interpretations, and other language-related services.
yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ àti àwọn Olùṣàkóso Àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ rẹ má a ń gbé ìgbésẹ̀ tó jẹ mọ́ àwọn ìlànà àmúdájú ìdárasí láti lè fọwọ́sọ̀yà pé àwọn ìtumọ̀-èdè, iṣẹ́ ògbùfọ̀ àti àwọn ìpèsè yín mìíran tó níí ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn iṣẹ́ èdè kúnjú òṣùwọ̀n, àti pé wọ́n ṣe rẹ́gí pẹ̀lú àṣà èdè náà.

english: Technology Integration:
yoruba: Ìṣàkópọ̀ Àwọn Ohun-èlò Ìmọ̀ Sáyẹ́ǹsì fún Àṣeyọrí Iṣẹ́:

english: Staying up-to-date with language technology tools, such as computer-assisted translation (CAT) software, machine translation, and terminology management systems, is essential to enhance productivity and efficiency.
yoruba: Níní ìmọ̀ tuntun jùlọ nípa àwọn ohun-èlò ìmọ̀ sáyẹ́ǹsì tó níí ṣe pẹ̀lú èdè, bíi ẹ̀yà àìrídìmú inú ẹ̀rọ kọ̀mpútà tó ń rannilọ́wọ́ láti ṣètúmọ̀ èdè, ìfẹ̀rọṣètúmọ̀-èdè, àti ètò ìṣàkóso àwọn ẹyọ ọ̀rọ̀, ṣe pàtàkì láti mú ìlọsíwájú bá níní àgbéjáde tó wúlò, tó sì ni ipa tó dára.

english: Legal and Ethical Compliance:
yoruba: Ìbọ̀wọ̀fún Àwọn Ohun tó jẹ mọ́ Òfin àti Ìhùwàsí:

english: You must ensure that your agency complies with all relevant laws and ethical guidelines for language service providers.
yoruba: Ìwọ gbọ́dọ̀ ríi dájú pé ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ bọ̀wọ̀ fún gbogbo àwọn òfin àti àlàkalẹ̀ ìhùwàsí tó yẹ fún àwọn olùpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè.

english: This includes data protection regulations, confidentiality agreements, and industry standards.
yoruba: Lára èyí ni ìlànà ìdáàbòbo détà, àwọn àdéhùn nípa ìpamọ́, àti àwọn àgbékalẹ̀ ẹ̀ka iṣẹ́ náà.

english: Business Growth:
yoruba: Ìdàgbàsókè Ìṣòwò:

english: As an LSP, you likely aim for business expansion.
yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Olùpèsè Iṣẹ́ Èdè, ó ṣeé ṣe kí o ní ìrètí àti mú ìṣòwò rẹ gbèrú síi.

english: This may involve marketing your services, exploring new client niches, and identifying opportunities to increase your agency's market share.
yoruba: Èyí lè níí ṣe pẹ̀lú mímú ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn mọ̀ nípa àwọn ìpèsè rẹ, kíkọ́ nípa àwọn abala iṣẹ́ tuntun tí àwọn oníbàárà ń fẹ́, àti ṣíṣe ìdámọ̀ àwọn àǹfàní tó wà láti mú ìpín ọjà ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ gbèrú síi.

english: Industry Knowledge:
yoruba: Ìmọ̀ Ẹ̀ka Iṣẹ́:

english: You keep yourself and your team updated with the latest developments in the language services industry, as it is a rapidly evolving field with advancements in machine translation and language technology.
yoruba: Ìwọ ń mú ìmọ rẹ àti ti àwọn ikọ̀ rẹ dójú ìwọ̀n nípa àwọn ohun ìtẹ̀síwájú tuntun jùlọ nínú ẹ̀ka iṣẹ́ ìṣètúmọ̀ èdè, nítorí tí ó jẹ́ ẹ̀ka tó ń yípadà ní kíákíá pẹ̀lú àwọn ìtẹ̀síwájú nínú ìfẹ̀rọṣètúmọ̀-èdè àti ìmúlò ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ tó jẹ mọ́ èdè.

english: Problem Solving:
yoruba: Wíwá Ojúùtú sí Ìṣòro:

english: In your role, you frequently encounter challenges, such as managing tight deadlines, handling client-specific requirements, and addressing linguistic nuances.
yoruba: Nínú ojúṣe rẹ, ìwọ má a ń bá àwọn ìpèníjà kan pàdé ní ọ̀pọ̀ ìgbà, gẹ́gẹ́ bíi ṣíṣàkóso àkókò kúkúrú fún píparí iṣẹ́, rírísí àwọn ohun pàtó tí oníbàárà kọ̀ọ̀kan ń fẹ́, àti kíkojú àwọn oríṣiríṣi ìyàtọ̀ tó wà nínú ìmọ̀ èdè.

english: Problem-solving skills are invaluable.
yoruba: Mímọ̀ọ́ṣe tó jẹ mọ́ wíwá ojúùtú sí ìṣòro kò ṣeé díyelé.

english: Financial Management:
yoruba: Ìṣàkóso Ọ̀rọ̀ Owó:

english: Managing the finances of your language service agency, including budgeting, pricing strategies, and profit margins, is crucial for long-term sustainability.
yoruba: Ìṣàkóso ọ̀rọ̀ owó ilé-iṣẹ́ ìpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè kéréje rẹ, èyí tó kan ṣíṣètò ìnáwó, ìpète-pèrò iye owó iṣẹ́, áti pípa àlà sí iye tó jẹ́ èrè, jẹ́ ohun tó ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀ fún ìfẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ ọlọ́jọ́-pípẹ́.

english: Your experience as a language service provider is dynamic, demanding a combination of business acumen, linguistic expertise, and people management skills to ensure the successful execution of language projects while maintaining strong client relationships and fostering business growth.
yoruba: Ìrírí rẹ gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè jẹ́ èyí tó ń yípadà láti ìgbà dé ìgbà, èyí tó nílò àpapọ̀ agbára láti lè ṣe ìpinnu tó yẹ lásìkò nípa òwò, ìkọ́ṣẹ̀mọṣẹ́ nínú ìmọ̀ èdè, àti mímọ̀ọ́ṣe nípa ìṣàkóso àwọn ènìyàn, láti lè ríi dájú pé ẹ̀yin ń ṣe àṣeyọrí nínú àwọn àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ èdè, ẹ̀yin ń fi ẹsẹ̀ ìbáṣepọ̀ tó lágbára múlẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn oníbàárà, ẹ̀yin sì ń mú òwò náà gbèrú síwájú síi.

english: I work as a language service service provider, with a registered agency in Nigeria that outsources tasks to language professionals.
yoruba: Mò ń ṣiṣẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí olùpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè, tó ní ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje kan tí a forúkọ rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìjọba, tó sì má a ń gbé iṣẹ́ fún àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ nínú èdè.

english: The company was registered in 2005 and has offered language-related services to several clients and bigger Language Service Providers worldwide.
yoruba: A ṣe ìforúkọsílẹ̀ ilé-iṣẹ́ náà ní ọdún 2005, òun sì ti ń pèsè àwọn iṣẹ́ tó níí ṣe pẹ̀lú èdè fún ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn oníbàárà àti àwọn Olùpèsè Iṣẹ́ Èdè ńláńlá káàkiri àgbáyé.

english: Describe my agency.
yoruba: Ṣàpèjúwe ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje mi.

english: Your agency in Nigeria, registered in 2005, that outsources tasks to language professionals is a well-established and reputable language service provider (LSP) with a distinctive profile and a solid track record.
yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ tí o ṣe ìforúkọsílẹ̀ rẹ̀ ní ọdún 2005, tó ń gbé iṣẹ́ fún àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ nínú èdè, jẹ́ olùpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè tó fẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀, tó sì lókìkí, pẹ̀lú ìrínisí tó dáyàtọ̀ àti àkọsílẹ̀ àṣeyọrí tó múnádóko.

english: Here's a description of your agency based on the information you provided:
yoruba: Èyí ni àpèjúwe ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ nípasẹ̀ àwọn àlàyé tí ìwọ pèsè:

english: Established Reputation:
yoruba: Òkìkí tò Fẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀:

english: Your agency, having been in operation since 2005, has built a strong and respected reputation within the language services industry.
yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ, èyí tó ti ń ṣiṣẹ́ láti ọdún 2005, ti ṣàkójọ òkìkí tó lágbára, tí a sì ń bọ̀wọ̀ fún laarin ẹ̀ka ìpèsè iṣẹ́ èdè.

english: This longevity signifies stability and trustworthiness.
yoruba: Ẹ̀mí gígùn yìí ń ṣàfihàn ìfẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ àti ṣíṣeéfọkàntán.

english: Nigerian Base:
yoruba: Ìpìlẹ̀ Orílẹ̀-èdè:

english: Being headquartered in Nigeria, your agency likely serves as a bridge between local and international clients, offering language services that cater to the diverse linguistic needs of the Nigerian market and beyond.
yoruba: Nítorí tí olú ilé-iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ wà ní orílẹ̀-èdè náà, ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ dúró gẹ́gẹ́ bí afárá laarin àwọn oníbàárà agbègbè náà àti àwọn ti ìlú òkèèrè, èyí tó ń pèsè àwọn iṣẹ́ èdè tó ń bá àwọn àìní tó jẹ mọ́ ìmọ̀ èdè pàdé ní ọjà orílẹ̀-èdè náà àti rékọjá ibẹ̀.

english: Global Reach:
yoruba: Ìtànkiri Kárí-ayé:

english: Your agency's success in working with both local and international clients suggests that it has a global reach.
yoruba: Àṣeyọrí ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ nínú bíbá àwọn oníbàárà agbègbè àti ti òkèèrè ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ ń tọ́ka sí pé ó ní ìtànkiri kárí-ayé.

english: This may include partnerships and collaborations with larger Language Service Providers (LSPs) worldwide, allowing you to tap into a broader client base.
yoruba: Lára èyí lè jẹ́ àwọn àjọṣepọ̀ àti àjọṣiṣẹ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú Àwọn Olùpèsè Iṣẹ́ Èdè káàkiri àgbáyé, èyí tó ń mú ọ ráàyè sí àkójọ àwọn oníbàárà tì iye wọn gbòòrò síi

english: Diverse Service Portfolio:
yoruba: Àkójọ Ìpèsè Iṣẹ́ àti Ọjà Lóriṣiríṣi:

english: Over the years, your agency has likely diversified its service offerings to cater to a wide range of language-related needs.
yoruba: Bí ọdún ṣe ń bá ọdún, ó ṣeé ṣe pé ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ ti mú àwọn oríṣiríṣi ìpèsè tí wọ́n ń fifúnni gbòòrò síi láti bá àwọn àìní iṣẹ́ èdè tó pọ̀ síi pàdé.

english: This may include translation, interpretation, localization, subtitling, transcription, and more.
yoruba: Lára èyí lè jẹ́ ìṣètúmọ̀-èdè, iṣẹ́ ògbùfọ̀, ìṣàyípadà èdè láti bá àwọn àìní agbègbè kan pàdé, kíkọ ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ sórí ìbòjú fídíò, ìṣàkọsílẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ, àti jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.

english: Skilled Language Professionals:
yoruba: Àwọn Akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ Òṣìṣẹ́ Èdè:

english: To maintain the quality of language services, your agency has a network of skilled and experienced language professionals, including translators, interpreters, editors, and linguistic experts who ensure that projects are handled with precision and cultural sensitivity.
yoruba: Láti fìdí ìdárasí iṣẹ́ èdè múlẹ̀, ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ ní ìtàkùn àwọn akọ́ṣẹ́mọṣẹ́ òṣìṣẹ́ èdè tó ní ìrírí tó yẹ, lára àwọn tó lè jẹ́ aṣètumọ̀-èdè, ògbùfọ̀, aṣàtúnkọ àṣìṣe inú àkọsílẹ̀, àti àwọn ọ̀mọ̀ràn iṣẹ́ èdè tó ń ṣàrídájú pé à ń fọwọ́ tó yẹ mú àwọn àkànṣe-iṣẹ́, a sì ń jẹ́ kí àfiyèsí oríṣi àṣà hàn nínú àwọn àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ tí à ń ṣe.

english: Robust Quality Assurance:
yoruba: Àmúdájú Ìdárasí tó Múnádóko:

english: Quality control and assurance are likely core components of your agency's operations.
yoruba: Ìṣàkóso àti àmúdájú ìdárasí ṣeé ṣe kó wà lára àwọn ohun tó ṣe kókó jùlọ nínú iṣẹ́-ṣíṣe ilé-iṣẹ́ kéréje rẹ.

english: This ensures that all language-related projects meet or exceed industry standards for accuracy and cultural relevance.
yoruba: Èyí ń mú u dánilójú pé gbogbo àwọn àkànṣe-iṣẹ́ tó jẹ mọ́ èdè ni ó kúnjú-òṣùwọ̀n tàbi ni ó rékọjá àwọn àlàkalẹ̀ ẹ̀ka iṣẹ́ náà nípa pípéye àti bíbá àṣà mu.

english: Technology Integration:
yoruba: Ìṣàkópọ̀ Àwọn Ohun-èlò Ìmọ̀ Sáyẹ́ǹsì fún Àṣeyọrí Iṣẹ́:

english: Staying up-to-date with language technology tools and software is integral to streamline processes and enhance efficiency.
yoruba: Níní ìmọ̀ tuntun jùlọ nípa àwọn irin-iṣẹ́ ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ àti ẹ̀yà àìrídìmú inú ẹ̀rọ kọ̀mpútà jẹ́ ohun tó ṣe pàtakì fún ìṣẹdéédé ìlànà iṣẹ́ àti láti fààyè gba ìṣàṣèyọrí.

english: FORCES OF ECONOMIC RECOVERY
yoruba: ÀWỌN AGBÁRA ÌDÁPADÀ ÌKÓLỌ ỌRỌ̀-AJÉ

english: The world today, lives in the midst of such an economic recession in the history of mankind that has left no nation untouched.
yoruba: Àwọn ènìyàn ní ayé òde-òní ń gbé ní àsìkò tí ọrọ̀-ajé le koko jùlọ nínú ìtàn ẹ̀dá ènìyàn, èyítí kò dá orílẹ̀-èdè kankan yòówù sí.

english: The economic crises in some nations can be likened to the days of Joseph, when the Bible records that money failed in Egypt.
yoruba: Àwọn làásìgbò nípa ọrọ̀-ajé ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè kan ni a lè fiwé ti àwọn ìgbà ayé Josefu, nígbàtí Bíbélì ṣe àkọsílẹ̀ pé owó kùnà ní Egipti.

english: Even the supposed first world nations are without exemption.
yoruba: Kò yọ àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó ti ní ìdàgbàsókè náà sílẹ̀ pàápàá.

english: The harder men try to come out, the deeper they are plunged into it.
yoruba: Bí àwọn ènìyàn ṣe ń gbìyànjú láti bọ́ nínú rẹ̀ sí ni wọ́n ṣe ń túbọ̀ wọ inú rẹ̀ síi.

english: Poverty today seems to be the norm among nations, rather than the exception.
yoruba: Òṣì ní òde-òní dàbí ohun tó jẹ́ déédé laarin àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè, dípò tí yóò fi jẹ́ ohun tí kìí ṣe déédé.

english: It has no respect for sex, race, colour or creed.
yoruba: Kìí bọ̀wọ̀ fún akọ tàbi abo, ẹ̀yà, àwọ̀, tàbí ìgbàgbọ́ ẹni.

english: This is in fulfilment of the prophecy in Isaiah 60:2:
yoruba: Èyí wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ inú ìwé Isaiah 60:2:

english: For, behold, the darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the people: but the LORD shall arise upon thee, and his glory shall be seen upon thee.
yoruba: Nitori kiyesi i, okùnkun bò aiye mọlẹ, ati okùnkun biribiri bò awọn enia: ṣugbọn Oluwa yio yọ lara rẹ, a o si ri ogo rẹ̀ lara rẹ.

english: But what is the origin of poverty?
yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n kí ni orísun òṣì?

english: In Genesis chapter 1, we see the very graphic description of creation.
yoruba: Ní Gẹnẹsisi orí 1, a rí àpèjúwe ìṣẹ̀dá lọ́nà tó hàn kedere.

english: In the beginning of all things, God created a very rich, prosperous earth, with everything reproducing after its kind, and man, made in the image of God and put in charge:
yoruba: Ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ohun gbogbo, Ọlọrun dá ayé tó ní ọlá, tó ní ọrọ̀, pẹ̀lú ohun gbogbo tó ń so èso ní irú tirẹ̀, àti ènìyàn, tí a dá ní àwòrán Ọlọrun, tí a sì fi ohun gbogbo sábẹ́ àkóso rẹ̀.

english: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.
yoruba: Ọlọrun si wipe, Jẹ ki a dá enia li aworan wa, gẹgẹ bi irí wa: ki nwọn ki o si jọba lori ẹja okun, ati lori ẹiyẹ oju-ọrun, ati lori ẹranko, ati lori gbogbo ilẹ, ati lori ohun gbogbo ti nrakò lori ilẹ.

english: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
yoruba: Bẹ̃li Ọlọrun dá enia li aworan rẹ̀, li aworan Ọlọrun li o dá a; ati akọ ati abo li o dá wọn.

english: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.
yoruba: Ọlọrun si súre fun wọn. Ọlọrun si wi fun wọn pe, Ẹ ma bi si i, ki ẹ si ma rẹ̀, ki ẹ si gbilẹ, ki ẹ si ṣe ikawọ rẹ̀; ki ẹ si ma jọba lori ẹja okun, ati lori ẹiyẹ oju-ọrun, ati lori ohun alãye gbogbo ti nrakò lori ilẹ.

english: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.
yoruba: Ọlọrun si wipe, kiye si i, Mo fi eweko gbogbo ti o wà lori ilẹ gbogbo ti nso eso fun nyin, ati igi gbogbo ninu eyiti iṣe igi eleso ti nso; ẹnyin ni yio ma ṣe onjẹ fun.

english: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.
yoruba: Ati fun gbogbo ẹranko ilẹ, ati fun gbogbo ẹiyẹ oju-ọrun, ati fun ohun gbogbo ti o nrakò lori ilẹ, ti iṣe alaye, ni mo fi eweko tutu gbogbo fun li onjẹ: o si ri bẹ̃.

english: Genesis 1:26-30
yoruba: Gẹnẹsisi 1:26-30

english: To wrap it all up, the Bible records in Genesis 2:8-12:
yoruba: Láti kásẹ̀ gbogbo rẹ̀ nílẹ̀, Bíbélì ṣàkọsílẹ̀ rẹ̀ nínú Gẹnẹsisi 2:8-12 pé:

english: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.
yoruba: OLUWA Ọlọrun si gbìn ọgbà kan niha ìla-õrùn ni Edeni; nibẹ̀ li o si fi ọkunrin na ti o ti mọ si.

english: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
yoruba: Lati inu ilẹ li OLUWA Ọlọrun mu onirũru igi hù jade wá, ti o dara ni wiwò, ti o si dara fun onjẹ; ìgi ìye pẹlu lãrin ọgbà na, ati igi ìmọ rere ati buburu.

english: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.
yoruba: Odò kan si ti Edeni ṣàn wá lati rin ọgbà na; lati ibẹ̀ li o gbé yà, o si di ipa ori mẹrin.

english: The name of the first is Pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
yoruba: Orukọ ekini ni Pisoni: on li eyiti o yi gbogbo ilẹ Hafila ká, nibiti wurà wà;

english: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
yoruba: Wurà ilẹ na si dara: nibẹ ni bedeliumu (ojia) wà ati okuta oniki.

english: Man lived in a garden of affluence and abundance of all things, and was given everything freely to enjoy.
yoruba: Ọmọ ènìyàn gbé ní ọgbà ọrọ̀ àti ọlá ńlá nínú ohun gbogbo, a sì fi ohun gbogbo fún un lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́ láti má a gbádùn.

english: So, wealth came along with creation and was equally distributed to every part of the world.
yoruba: Nítorí náà, ọrọ̀ wáyé papọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìṣẹ̀dá ni, a sì pin dọ́gba káàkiri ibi gbogbo ní àgbáyé.

english: As a matter of fact, up until 1400, the whole world was said to be at the same level of civilization and development.
yoruba: Pàápàá jùlọ, títí di 1400 (ọ̀rúndún kẹrìnlá), gbogbo àgbáyé ni a gbọ́ pé ó wà ní ipele ọ̀làjú àti ìdàgbàsókè kan náà.

english: So, what happened to us?
yoruba: Nítorí náà, kí ló wá ṣẹlẹ̀ sí wa?

english: The Bible says:
yoruba: Bíbélì wí pé:

english: “And there was war in heaven:”
yoruba: “Ogun si mbẹ li ọrun:”

english: (Revelation 12:7).
yoruba: (Ifihan 12:7).

english: The subject of war is not new to man.
yoruba: Ohun tó ń jẹ́ ogun kìí ṣe ohun tuntun létí ọmọ ènìyàn.

english: If the devil could organize to fight in heaven, where he knew for a surety that he would fail, how much more would he fight with men, taking advantage of their ignorance.
yoruba: Bí èṣù bá lè ṣètò láti dá ìjà sílẹ̀ ní òde ọ̀run, níbití òun ti mọ̀ dájúdájú pé òun kò lè borí, báwo ni a ṣe wá rò pé kò lè bá ènìyàn jìjàkadì, kí ó sì lo àìmọkan wọn lódí sí wọn.

english: It is a basic science law that every object remains at rest until a force is applied to it.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ òfin ìpìlẹ̀ nínú sáyẹ́ǹsì pé gbogbo nǹkan a má a wà ní ipò ìsinmi títí di ìgbà tí a bá lo agbára sí i.

english: So also, every change of position calls for the application of relevant forces.
yoruba: Bákan náà, gbogbo ìṣípòpadà a má a nílò ìmúlò àwọn agbára tó yẹ.

english: Certain forces must come into play, before any object can change from one position to another.
yoruba: Àwọn agbára kan gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ lílò, kí ohunkóhun tó lè ṣípòpadà láti ibìkan sí òmíràn.

english: It will not change position because it has to change or it is programmed to change; it will only change if the relevant forces are applied.
yoruba: Kì yóò ṣípòpadà nítorí tí ó gbọ́dọ̀ yípadà tàbí nítorí tí a ti ṣètó rẹ̀ láti yípadà; yóò yípadà bí a bá lo àwọn agbára tó yẹ fún un nìkan ni.

english: Money failure is not new, but then, recovery is also not new.
yoruba: Títán owó kìí ṣe ohun tuntun, ṣùgbọ́n ṣá, ìpadàbọ̀sípò náà kìí ṣe ohun tuntun pẹ̀lú.

english: There was a time recorded in scriptures, when money failed in Egypt and men offered themselves for sale in exchange for food.
yoruba: Àsìkò kan wà tí a ṣàkọsílẹ̀ rẹ̀ nínú ìwé-mímọ́ pé owó tán ní Egipti, àwọn ènìyàn sì gbé ara wọn sílẹ̀ bí ọjà fún títà ní pàṣípààrọ̀ fún oúnjẹ.

english: And when money failed in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came unto Joseph, and said, Give us bread: for why should we die in thy presence? for the money faileth.
yoruba: Nigbati owo si tán ni ilẹ Egipti, ati ni ilẹ Kenaani, gbogbo awọn ara Egipti tọ̀ Josefu wá, nwọn si wipe, Fun wa li onjẹ: nitori kili awa o ṣe kú li oju rẹ? owo sa tán.

english: Wherefore shall we die before thine eyes, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants unto Pharaoh: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, that the land be not desolate.
yoruba: Nitori kili awa o ṣe kú li oju rẹ, ati awa ati ilẹ wa? fi onjẹ rà wa ati ilẹ wa, ati awa ati ilẹ wa yio ma ṣe ẹrú Farao: ki o si fun wa ni irugbìn, ki awa ki o le yè, ki a má kú, ki ilẹ ki o má ṣe di ahoro.

english: Genesis 47:15,19
yoruba: Gẹnẹsisi 47:15,19

english: Economic recovery is a universal possibility, and it has been proved in several parts of the world.
yoruba: Ìpadàbọ̀sípò ọrọ̀-ajé jẹ́ ohun tó ṣeé ṣe káàkiri àgbáyé, a sì ti fi ìdí èyí múlẹ̀ ní ibi púpọ̀ káàkiri àgbáyé.

english: History records that the nation of America went through a great time of economic depression, yet today, the world’s economy is determined by the value of the American dollar.
yoruba: Ìtàn ṣe àkọsílẹ̀ rẹ̀ pé orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹrika la àsìkò ìyàn ńlá kan kọjá, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni lónìí, iye ti dọ́là Amẹrika jẹ́ ni a fi ń mọ bí ọrọ̀-ajé àgbáyé ṣe ń lọ sí.

english: China has become a nation to watch today, because it is now gradually taking over economically after a process of recovery.
yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Ṣaina ti di orílẹ̀-èdè tí a gbọ́dọ̀ má a ṣọ́ lódè-òní nítorí tí ó ti ń gba ìṣàkóso ọrọ̀-ajé ní díẹ̀díẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ìmúpadàbọ̀sípò rẹ̀.

english: It is taking over not because of its population, as it has always been highly populated, but because there is an economic re-awakening that is repositioning her in the forefront economically.
yoruba: Kìí ṣe nítorí iye àwọn ènìyàn tó wà níbẹ̀ ni ó ṣe ń gba ìṣàkóso, nítorí ó ti jẹ́ ibití àwọn ènìyàn pọ̀ sí tẹ́lẹ̀rí, ṣùgbọ́n nítorí tí ìtanijí nípa ọrọ̀-ajé ń lọ lọ́wọ́ níbẹ̀, èyí tó ń fi í sí ipò àṣíwájú nínú ètò ọrọ̀-ajé.

english: At independence, Singapore was assisted by Ghana.
yoruba: Lásìkò òmìnira, Ghana ni ó ran Singapọ lọ́wọ́.

english: But today, see the gap between Singapore and Ghana; it cannot be measured.
yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n lónìí, ẹ wo àlàfo tó wà laarin Singapọ àti Ghana; kò ní ìwọ̀n.

english: The G8 is powerful, not because of its political system, but due to its economic power.
yoruba: Àjọ tó lágbára ni G8 jẹ́, kìí ṣe nítorí ètò òṣèlú rẹ̀, ṣùgbọ́n nítorí agbára rẹ̀ nípa ọrọ̀-ajé.

english: Winning the war against poverty begins with a correct diagnosis of what causes poverty.
yoruba: Bíborí ogun tó ń gbani lọ́wọ́ òṣì a má a bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú níní òye tó tọ́ nípa ohun tó ń fa òṣì.

english: When you begin at the beginning, you are too sure of the end.
yoruba: Nígbàtí o bá bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀, òpin yóò dá ọ lójú gidi gan ni.

english: Often, particularly in the developing nations, it is wrong diagnosis that causes the death of patients.
yoruba: Nígbà púpọ̀, pàápàá jùlọ ní àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó ṣì ń ní ìdàgbàsókè, òye àìtọ́ nípa irú àìsàn tó ń bá ni jà ni ó má a ń fa ikú àwọn aláìsàn.

english: A man may be suffering from cancer of the lungs, but he is being treated for a common cold.
yoruba: Àrùn jẹjẹrẹ káńsà ti ẹ̀dọ̀fóró lè má a bá ènìyàn jà, ṣùgbọ́n kí wọ́n má a ṣe ìtọ́jú fún un lórí àìsàn òtútù lásán.

english: After his death, the doctors see the need for a postmortem, to try to find out what actually killed him.
yoruba: Lẹ́yìn ikú rẹ̀, àwọn dọ́kítà á wá ríi pé àwọn nílò láti ṣe àyẹ̀wò òkú rẹ̀, láti gbìyànjú láti mọ ohun tó pa á gangan.

english: As long as the diagnosis is wrong, you cannot hope for economic recovery.
yoruba: Níwọ̀n ìgbà tó bá ṣì jẹ́ pé òye ohun tó ń ṣe òkùnfà rẹ̀ kò tíì jẹ́ títọ́, ènìyàn kò lè má a ní ìrètí pé ọrọ̀-ajé yóò dí mímúpadàbọ̀sípò.

english: Until you change the way you think, you cannot change the way you live.
yoruba: Bí o kò bá tíì yí bí o ṣe ń ronú padà, ìwọ kò lè yí irú ìgbé-ayé tí ìwọ ń gbé padà.

english: The cause of poverty is more of the mind than it is of the hand.
yoruba: Ohun tó ń ṣe òkùnfà òṣì níí ṣe pẹ̀lú èrò ẹni ju ọwọ́ ẹni lọ.

english: It is more of mentality than it is of activity.
yoruba: Ó jẹ mọ́ ọgbọ́n orí ju iṣẹ́ ọwọ́ ẹni lọ.

english: As a man thinks in his heart, so is he.
yoruba: Nitoripe bi ènìyàn ti nṣiro li ọkàn rẹ̀, bẹ̃ li o ri.

english: Likewise, until your mentality is healed, your recovery is not in view.
yoruba: Lọ́nà kan náà, bí èrò rẹ kò bá tíì gba ìmúláradá, ìmúpadàbọ̀sípò rẹ kò tíì lè wáyé.

english: It is your mental picture that determines your actual future.
yoruba: Àwòràn tó wà nínú ọpọlọ rẹ ni yóò sọ bí ọjọ́-ọ̀la rẹ yóò ṣe rí gangan.

english: The mind has to be re-positioned before a recovery can be experienced.
yoruba: A gbọ́dọ̀ mú èrò wa wá sí ipò tó yẹ kí a tó lè ní ìrírí ìmúpadàbọ̀sípò.

english: Therefore, it takes possessing a possibility mentality to recover your economic dignity.
yoruba: Nítorí náà, èrò ẹni gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ èyí tó mọ̀ pé ohun gbogbo ló ṣeé ṣe kí a tó lè dá ọ padà sípò ọrọ̀-ajé tó buyìnkúnni.

english: It is important to recognize that nothing erodes human dignity like poverty.
yoruba: Ò ṣe pàtàkì láti mọ̀ pé kò sí ohun tó ń sọ ènìyàn dí aláìníyì bí òṣì.

english: Poverty has no honour or dignity whatsoever attached to it.
yoruba: Òṣì kò ní ọ̀wọ̀ tàbí iyì kankan tó so pọ̀ mọ́ ọ.

english: Today, the world has no regards whatsoever for any input in world affairs from Africa, because of her poverty.
yoruba: Lónìí, ayé kò ní ìbọ̀wọ̀fún yóòwù fún ohunkóhun tí Afrika ní láti sọ nípa ohun tó ń lọ láyé nítorí óṣì rẹ̀.

english: Africa has no voting power, our large population notwithstanding.
yoruba: Afrika kò ní ẹ̀tọ́ àti dìbò kankan lórí èyí, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ènìyàn pọ̀ jantiri níbẹ̀.

english: Population-wise, Africa is about twice the size of the United States of America, but our almost six hundred million population is of no consequence to the world. Why?
yoruba: Bí a bá ń sọ nípa iye ènìyàn, Afrika fẹ́rẹ̀ tó ẹ̀ẹ̀mejì iye ti Amẹrika, ṣùgbọ́n iye ènìyàn tó fẹ́rẹ̀ tó mílíọ̀nù mẹ́fà kò ní ipa kankan pàtó lórí àwọn ènìyàn tó kù lórí ilẹ̀-ayé. Kíni ìdí èyí?

english: Like the Bible says, “…The voice of a poor man is not heard and his words are despised” (Ecclesiastes 9:14-17).
yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Bíbélì ṣe wí, “...Ohùn táláká kìí tó òkè, a sì má a ń kẹ́gàn ọgbọ́n rẹ̀” (Oniwasu 9:14-17).

english: Even though his wisdom will deliver cities, no one knows anything about that poor man.
yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọgbọ́n rẹ yóò gba àwọn ìlú ńláńla là, kò sí ẹni tó mọ ohunkóhun nípa ọkùnrin táláká yẹn.

english: He is an employee, so the employer takes the glory.
yoruba: Ó jẹ́ ẹnití a gbàsíṣẹ́, nítorí náà agbanisíṣẹ́ rẹ̀ ló ni gbogbo ògo.

english: Though Africa’s input in America’s sugarcane plantation as labourers was part of what helped in revitalizing the economy of America, the African is still not considered as any creation of relevance, because the voice of a poor man is not heard, and his wisdom is despised.
yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé iṣẹ́ tí Afrika ṣe ní oko ìrèké Amẹrika gẹ̀gẹ̀ bí alágbàṣe jẹ́ ara ohun tó ṣèrànwọ́ láti mú ọrọ̀-ajé Amẹrika padabọ̀sípò, a kò tíì ka àwọn ará Afrika kún ẹ̀dá kan tó ṣe pàtàkì, nítorí ohùn táláká kìí tó òkè, a sì má a ń kẹ́gàn ọgbọ́n rẹ̀.

english: So, no matter what we know as Africans, until we recover our economic dignity, we will remain the footmat of the world.
yoruba: Nítorí náà, bí ó ti wù kí ohun yóòwù tí a mọ̀ nípa àwọn ará Afrika ṣe lè rí, bí a kò bá tíì dá ọrọ̀-ajé wa padà sípò tó buyìnkúnni, àwa yóò ṣì má a jẹ́ ẹní-ìnusẹ̀ gbogbo àgbáyé ni.

english: That is why economic recovery is a must.
yoruba: Nítorí náà ni ìmúpadàbọ̀sípò ọrọ̀-ajé ṣe jẹ́ ohun tó pọn dandan.

english: Our human dignity as a people must be recovered.
yoruba: A gbọ́dọ̀ mú iyí ìṣẹ̀dá wa padàbọ̀sípò.

english: Economic failure or depression is no news, just as economic recovery is no news either.
yoruba: Ìkùnà tàbí ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì ètò ọrọ̀-ajé kíì ṣe ìròyìn tuntun, bí ó ṣe jẹ́ pé ìmúpadàbọ̀sípò ètò ọrọ̀-ajé kìí ṣe ìròyìn tuntun pẹ̀lú.

english: All it takes to recover from an economic depression or failure, is to know where to begin from and start treating the disease from there.
yoruba: Ohun tí ènìyàn nílò láti padàbọ̀sípò lẹ́yìn ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì tàbí ìkùnà ọrọ̀-ajé ni láti mọ ibití yóò ti bẹ̀rẹ̀, kí ó sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ṣe ìwòsàn fún àrùn náà láti ibẹ̀.

english: Mentality!
yoruba: Èrò ọpọlọ!

english: I was privileged to be at the Oral Roberts University in America some years ago.
yoruba: Mo ní àǹfàní láti wà ní Unifásitì Oral Roberts ní Amẹrika ní bí ọdún mélòó kan sẹ́yìn.

english: I walked around the campus ground, admiring all I saw there.
yoruba: Mo rìn káàkiri lórí ilẹ̀ ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ giga náà, níbití ohun gbogbo tí mo rí ti jọmilójú.

english: As I walked around the campus, I found myself saying, “This is God; but it can happen anywhere else.”
yoruba: Bí mo ṣe ń rìn kaàkiri lórí ilẹ́ ilé-ẹ̀kọ́ gíga náà, mo kàn rí ara mi bí mo ṣe ń sọ pé, “Ọlọrun ló ṣe èyí, ṣùgbọ́n ó ṣeé ṣe níbòmíràn náà.”

english: That is the kind of mentality that brings about a recovery:
yoruba: Irú èrò ọpọlọ bẹ́ẹ̀ ló má a ń fa ìmúpadàbọ̀sípò:

english: “...but it can happen anywhere else!”
yoruba: “...ṣùgbọ́n ó ṣeé ṣe níbòmíràn náà!”

english: I know that in my lifetime, Africa will start causing the same positive concern that China is causing the world today.
yoruba: Mo mọ̀ pé ní ojú ẹ̀mí mi, Afrika náà yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ní ṣe irú àwọn ohun tó kúnnilójú lọ́nà tó dára báwọ̀nyí tí Ṣaina ń ṣe ní àgbáyé lónìí.

english: No longer should Africans rush abroad to continue the slavery of our forefathers; we should all remain at home, and with our individual vision and mission, begin to make contributions that will move the continent towards economic recovery.
yoruba: Kò yẹ kí àwọn ará Afrika má a sálọ sí àwọn ìlú òkèèrè láti má a lọ tẹ̀síwájú pẹ̀lú ẹrú-ṣíṣe tí àwọn bàbá ńla wa ṣe kù; gbogbo wa gbọ́dọ̀ dúró sílé, àti pẹ̀lú àlá wa àti iṣẹ́ tí a rán wa wá sáyé láti ṣe, kí á bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí sa ipá wa tí yóò mú àpapọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè wa padà bọ̀ sí ipò ètò ọrọ̀-ajé tó dára.

english: With all of us pulling our resources together, very soon we will cause an eruption that the world cannot ignore.
yoruba: Bí gbogbo wa bá fọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ lápapọ̀, láìpẹ́ àwa yóò fa ìrúsókè tí gbogbo àgbáyé kò ní lè fọwọ́rọ́sẹ́yìn.

english: Very soon, it will be Africa’s turn for an industrial revolution!
yoruba: Láìpẹ́, yóò kan Afrika láti mú àyípadà wáyé ní ẹ̀ka lílò ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ láti fi ṣàgbéjáde àwọn ohun tuntun.

english: The economic dignity of this continent will be recovered.
yoruba: Iyì ètò ọrọ̀-ajé àpapọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè wa wọ̀nyí yóò padàbọ̀sípò.

english: You may choose to be a part of it or be somewhere else on a slave trade trip and be hearing of what is happening back home.
yoruba: O lè yàn láti jẹ́ ara èyí tàbí láti wà ní ibòmíràn nínú ìrìn-àjò oko-ẹrú, kí o sì má a gbọ́ nípa nǹkan tó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ nílé.

english: It is a choice you must make.
yoruba: Èyí jẹ́ àṣàyàn tí o gbọ́dọ̀ yàn.

english: You will need to wake up and subject yourself to the reorientation and reconstruction of your thinking process, in order to regain your human value.
yoruba: Wàá nílò láti jídìde, kí o fi ara rẹ sílẹ̀ fún àtúntò àti àtúnkọ́ ìlànà èrò rẹ, kí o bá a lè tún jèèrè iyì tó yẹ fún ọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹ̀dá ènìyàn lẹ́ẹ̀kansíi.

english: When we were little children in the faith, we used to sing songs like “When I get to heaven, there will be no more sorrow, no more hunger, no more sadness,” everything was post dated to heaven.
yoruba: Nígbàtí a jẹ́ èwe nínú ìgbàgbọ́, àwa má a ń kọ àwọn orin kan báyìí pé “Bí mo bá dé ọ̀run, kì yóò sí ìkáànú mọ́, kì yóò sí ebi mọ́, kì yóò sí ìbànújẹ́ mọ́,”, ohun gbogbo ni a má a ń sún síwájú di ìgbà tí a bá dé ọ̀run.

english: We were taught that every good thing was going to be found when you get to heaven.
yoruba: A kọ́ wa nígbà náà pé ohun rere gbogbo yóò jẹ́ tiwa nígbàtí a bá dé ọ̀run.

english: But bit by bit, the mystery of God’s will began to unfold and now the earth is beginning to take on a heavenly identity.
yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n díẹ̀díẹ̀, ìjìnlẹ̀ tó wà nínú Ọlọrun bẹ̀rẹ̀ síí farahàn, ayé sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ nísìnyí láti má a gbé ààmì ìdánimọ̀ ti ọ̀run wọ̀.

english: That is, by the understanding of His will, you will disarm all principalities and powers, you will make an open show of the devil.
yoruba: Èyí ni pé, nípasẹ̀ òye ìfẹ́ Rẹ̀, ìwọ yóò gba gbogbo ohun ìjà àwọn ìjòyè àti ti àwọn alágbára kúrò lọ́wọ́ wọn, ìwọ yóò sì tú èṣù sí ìhòhò ní ìta gbangba.

english: You cannot keep on struggling on the earth.
yoruba: O kò lè má a la ìrọ́jú kọjá nígbà gbogbo lórí ilẹ̀ ayé.

english: The more light you have, the more heavenly your life.
yoruba: Bí ìmọ́lẹ̀ tí o ní ṣe pọ̀ tó ni ìgbésí ayé rẹ yóò ṣe dàbí ti ọ̀run tó.

english: If you appreciate the mystery of His will, you will live a heavenly life on earth.
yoruba: Bí ìwọ bá ní òye ìjìnlẹ̀ nípa ìfẹ́ Rẹ̀, ìwọ yóò gbé ìgbé-ayé ti ọ̀run ní orí ilẹ̀ ayé.

english: It is just like what has happened concerning physical things like technology.
yoruba: Ó fẹ́ dàbí ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí àwọn nǹkan tí a lè fojú rí ni, bí ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ.

english: For instance, in the early days of radio communication, you needed to shout “Over! Over!” at the top of your voice.
yoruba: Fún àpẹẹrẹ, nígbàtí ìbáraẹnisọ̀rọ̀ nípasẹ̀ ẹ̀rọ rédíò ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wáyé, o gbọ́dọ̀ pariwo pé “Ó parí! Ó parí!” bí ohùn rẹ bá ṣe lè lọ sókè tó.
